alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 9:33PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Chippewa, Yellow Medicine and Lac qui Parle Counties. .Warm temperatures continue to melt upstream snowpack and raise river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Montevideo. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Sanitary sewers begin to be affected at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 PM CDT Wednesday, the stage was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight and continue rising to a crest of 17.6 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.5 feet on 06/24/2014. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine
